text: Sidi Salah Bou Kabrine Mosque () was a Tunisian mosque located in northern suburb of the medina of Tunis. It does not exist anymore.Mohamed Belkhodja, Tārīkh maʻālim al-tawḥīd fī al-qadīm wa-fī al-Jadīd, Tunis, al-Maṭbaʻah al- Tūnisīyah, 1939, 429 p == Localization== The mosque was located in Sidi Aloui Street. == Etymology== It got its name from a saint, Sidi Salah Bou Kabrine, whose tomb is between Bizerte and Mateur. == History== It got destroyed after the replanning of the Sidi Aloui Street. == References == Category:Mosques in Tunis
title: Sidi Salah Bou Kabrine Mosque
